IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: ORGANIZATION'S UNIFIED MISSION IS TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE PEOPLE IN THIS SERVICE AREA THROUGH THE PROVISION OF QUALITY HEALTH CARE PROGRAMS, SERVICES, EQUIPMENT AND PERSONAL CARE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE ASSOCIATION'S PURPOSE IS TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A FACILITY FOR THE CARE OF PERSONS SUFFERING FROM ILLNESS OR DISABILITIES, REGARDLESS OF RACE, COLOR, CREED, SEX, NATIONAL ORIGIN OR ABILITY TO PAY; TO CARRY ON EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO RENDERING CARE TO THE SICK AND INJURED; AND TO PARTICIPATE IN ANY ACTIVITY DESIGNED AND CARRIED ON SO AS TO PROMOTE THE GENERAL HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Description: OPERATION OF A 30 BED HOSPITAL FACILITY AND A 19 BED ATTACHED NURSING HOME FACILITY WHICH PROVIDE ALL ROUTINE AND ANCILLARY SERVICES. SERVICES INCLUDED 25,979 OUTPATIENT REGISTRATIONS, 7,023 RURAL HEALTH CLINIC VISITS, 4,260 INPATIENT DAYS & 4,919 EMERGENCY ROOM VISITS.

ProgramServiceRevenue.Description: CHARGE FOR MEDICAL SRVC, ROOM, CARE & OTHER

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FUNDS ARE TO BE USED FOR BOND RESERVE FUND, A LETTER OF CREDIT AGREEMENT, OPERATIONS, AND MAINTENANCE OF ASSOCIATION.

Name.BusinessNameLine1: SHELBY MEM HOSP SKILLED NURSING UNIT

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CostingMethodUsed: THE COSTS REPORTED IN THE TABLE IN PART I, LINE 7 USED A RATIO OF PATIENT CARE COSTS TO CHARGES AS COMPUTED IN WORKSHEET 2 OF THE FORM INSTRUCTIONS. THIS METHODOLOGY WAS USED FOR ALL PATIENT SEGMENTS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PercentOfTotalExpenseExpln: THE ORGANIZATION HAD BAD DEBT EXPENSE IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,439,567 REPORTED ON PART IX, LINE 25, HOWEVER, IT HAS BEEN SUBTRACTED FOR PURPOSES OF CALCULATING THE PERCENTAGE IN THIS COLUMN.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: THE ASSOCIATION REPORTS PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE FOR SERVICES RENDERED AT NET REALIZABLE AMOUNTS FROM THIRD-PARTY PAYERS, PATIENTS AND OTHERS. THE ASSOCIATION PROVIDES AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS BASED UPON A REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION AND EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS. AS A SERVICE TO THE PATIENT, THE ASSOCIATION BILLS THIRD-PARTY PAYERS DIRECTLY AND BILLS THE PATIENT WHEN THE PATIENT'S LIABILITY IS DETERMINED. PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE DUE IN FULL WHEN BILLED. ACCOUNTS ARE CONSIDERED DELINQUENT AND SUBSEQUENTLY WRITTEN OFF AS BAD DEBTS BASED ON INDIVIDUAL CREDIT EVALUATION AND SPECIFIC CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE ACCOUNT. THE AMOUNT REPORTED ON LINE 2 WAS DETERMINED USING THE COST TO CHARGE RATIO.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: THE AMOUNT REPORTED ON LINE 6 WAS OBTAINED FROM THE ORGANIZATION'S MEDICARE COST REPORT.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: SHELBY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL HAS CONDUCTED JOINT COMMUNITY HEALTH ASSESSMENTS THROUGH A LOCAL COMMUNITY HEALTH COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF EXECUTIVES OF SHELBY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, PHYSICIAN REPRESENTATION FROM THE SHELBY COUNTY BOARD OF HEALTH, A REPRESENTATIVE FROM THE SHELBY COUNTY COMMUNITY SERVICES, A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, AND LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENT OFFICIALS. DATA FROM DIFFERENT GROUPINGS WAS COLLECTED AND ANALYZED TO HELP ESTABLISH PRIORITIES. GROUPINGS INCLUDED DEMOGRAPHIC AND SOCIOECONOMIC CHARACTERISTICS, GENERAL HEALTH AND ACCESS TO CARE, MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH CARE, CHRONIC DISEASE, INFECTIOUS DISEASE, AND ENVIRONMENTAL/OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH AND INJURY CONTROL.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: MULTIPLE AVENUES OF EDUCATION ARE UTILIZED TO INSURE ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS ARE AWARE OF AVAILABILITY OF ASSISTANCE THROUGH GOVERNMENTAL AND HOSPITAL BASED PROGRAMS. PATIENTS ARE PROVIDED WITH A PACKET OF INFORMATION THAT DETAILS THE AVAILABILITY OF UNINSURED DISCOUNTS AND CHARITY CARE PROGRAMS. ALL STATEMENTS WITH PATIENT DUE BALANCES HAVE WORDING INCLUDED TO SHOW THE AVAILABILITY OF SUCH ASSISTANCE. PRINTED MATERIALS CLEARLY IDENTIFY THE AVAILABILITY OF PROGRAMS. THE HOSPITAL WEB SITE ALSO HAS PROMINENT LANGUAGE ON ALL PAGES CONCERNING AVAILABILITY OF ASSISTANCE.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: SHELBY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL PRIMARILY SERVES THE RESIDENTS OF SHELBY COUNTY, ILLINOIS. TOTAL POPULATION IS 21,874 ACCORDING TO THE 2008 CENSUS ESTIMATES AVAILABLE ON FACTFINDER.CENSUS.GOV. 22% OF RESIDENTS ARE UNDER THE AGE OF 18; 18.6% ARE 65 AND OLDER. 10.4% OF ALL PEOPLE ARE IDENTIFIED AS BEING AT OR BELOW POVERTY LEVEL.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: SINCE 1918, SHELBY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL HAS PROVIDED FOR THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF SHELBY COUNTY AND OTHER SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. SMH IS LOCATED IN CENTRAL ILLINOIS, IT IS THE ONLY HOSPITAL IN SHELBY COUNTY. SMH IS COMMITTED TO THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF THE PEOPLE IT SERVES. OVER THE LAST 90+ YEARS, SMH HAS PROVIDED EMERGENT AND NON-EMERGENT CARE REGARDLESS OF A PERSON'S ABILITY TO PAY. SMH WORKS CLOSELY WITH OTHER AGENCIES IN THE AREA TO PROVIDE FOR THOSE NEEDS BEYOND THE SCOPE OF THE HOSPITAL, SUCH AS TRANSPORTATION, PRESCRIPTION ASSISTANCE, SOCIAL WELFARE AND DAILY LIVING NEEDS. SMH PROVIDES THE RESOURCES TO RECRUIT HEALTHCARE WORKERS, PHYSICIAN ASSISTANTS, AND PHYSICIANS TO THE AREA. SMH HAS ESTABLISHED A RURAL HEALTH CARE CENTER TO HELP COMBAT THE PHYSICIAN SHORTAGE IN RURAL AMERICA AND PROVIDE FOR THOSE UNABLE TO PAY FOR SUCH CARE. MEMBERS OF THE SMH TEAM ARE ACTIVE MEMBERS IN THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE OF SHELBY COUNTY, THE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE, THE MID-ILLINOIS CHAPTER OF THE AMERICAN RED CROSS AND OTHER CIVIC AND NOT FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO THE BETTERMENT OF LIVING STANDARDS FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE AREA. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND MANAGEMENT OF SMH ARE COMMITTED TO PROVIDING THE BEST IN CARE AND EQUIPMENT TO THE COMMUNITY AS IS DEMONSTRATED IN OUR MOST RECENT PURCHASE OF DIGITAL MAMMOGRAPHY EQUIPMENT, LAPAROSCOPIC SURGERY EQUIPMENT AND NEW CARDIAC MONITORING SYSTEMS IN THE PAST TWO YEARS. ADDITIONALLY, SMH HAS SPENT MONIES AND TIME IN MEETING MEANINGFUL USE FOR THE COMPUTERIZED MEDICAL RECORD. SMH'S COMMITMENT TO ELECTRONIC MEDICAL RECORDS MAKES US ONE OF THE FEW SMALL RURAL HOSPITALS IN THE NATION APPLYING TO THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT FOR THE FUNDS AS OF JANUARY 2011 UNDER THE AMERICAN RECOVERY ACT OF 2009. ALL FUNDS ARE RETAINED BY THE CORPORATION AND REINVESTED IN THE HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY PRESENT OR FUTURE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART IV, SECTION A, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CFO FOR ACCURACY. NO REVIEW WAS OR WILL BE CONDUCTED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING BODY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART IV, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS OR TRUSTEES, AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANNUALLY INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO HOLDS QUARTERLY MEETINGS WITH EMPLOYEES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A/B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WAGE SCALE IS PREPARED USING COMPARISON INFO FROM OTHER HOSPITALS. IT IS PREPARED BY THE HUMAN RESOURCE DIRECTOR AND ENFORCED BY THE HUMAN RESOURCE DIRECTOR AND THE CFO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCESS FOR MAKING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
